channel.title: game art on Surfacedfox's Pages
channel.description: Recent content in game art on Surfacedfox's Pages

item.title: Translating a Forest
item.description: As aptly pointed out in Jacob Geller’s video, A Thousand Ways of Seeing a Forest, videogames, or any art for that matter, are an exercise in translation; Translating an experience to an interactive form, paper, music, or words. Jacob juxtaposes this concept with several translations of a Tang-dynasty poem, where the same Mandarin words could be interpreted in several ways when translated to English. What do the translators see, and focus on when doing so?
